Required includes

<script src='//web-toolkit.global.sky.com/{{ site.version }}/scripts/toolkit.min.js'></script> <link rel="stylesheet" href="//web-toolkit.global.sky.com/{{ site.version }}/stylesheets/toolkit.css"/> <link rel="stylesheet" href="//web-toolkit.global.sky.com/{{ site.version }}/fonts/skycons.css"/>

With RequireJS

Dont use the JS as above, but point the RequireJS config to the 'toolkit' location. 

requirejs.config({
        paths:{
        'toolkit':'http://web-toolkit.global.sky.com/{{ site.version }}/scripts/toolkit.min.js'
        }
        });

You can now 'require' and use the toolkit using the following: 

require(['toolkit'],function(toolkit){
        toolkit.even.emit('click');
        });

Setting IE Classes

Please add the relevant internet explorer classes using the lt-ie10 method.

<!--[if IE 7]> <html class="lt-ie10 lt-ie9 lt-ie8" > <![endif]--> <!--[if IE 8]> <html class="lt-ie10 lt-ie9" > <![endif]--> <!--[if IE 9]> <html class="lt-ie10" > <![endif]--> <!--[if gt IE 9]><!--> <html lang="en" > <!--<![endif]-->

HTML5 Compatibility

Please add the following into you head tag

<!--[if lt IE 10]><script type="text/javascript"> document.createElement('header'); document.createElement('section'); document.createElement('footer'); document.createElement('article'); document.createElement('aside'); document.createElement('hgroup'); document.createElement('nav'); document.createElement('figure'); document.createElement('figcaption'); </script><![endif]-->

Using Grunt

To handle dependency management on the server side, you will need to exclude the toolkit file from being optimized. In your gruntfile, add the following to the requireJS options: options: { paths: { toolkit: 'empty:' } },
